title: Cognitive Load Theory: Don't Overload the Brain
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cognitive Load Theory: Don't Overload the Brain.

buildup.text: John Sweller's Cognitive Load Theory says working memory has limited capacity. Exceeding it blocks all learning.

discovery.text: Three types of load: intrinsic (topic complexity), extraneous (bad design), and germane (productive thinking). Cut the

twist.text: Most educational materials are overloaded with decoration, animation, and text ‚Äî all of which compete with actual

climax.text: The best instruction reduces unnecessary load so all mental capacity goes to thinking. Simplicity is a teaching

punchline.text: If your slide needs a paragraph, your lesson needs a redesign.

quiz.question: What does Cognitive Load Theory recommend?
options: Present as much information as possible
Reduce unnecessary cognitive load so working memory can focus on learning
